page.title: 07AGRICULTURE NEAR SHALBOURNE
page.content: Arable farming is the principal indus- try of the area which includes parts of six estates; the largest,{Polesdon, has about 50% of the total acreage. Once part of{Stype Estate,}the farm's recent history reflects the changes which have taken place in agriculture here:{dairying}has been{abandoned}in favour of cash crops like wheat, barley, oilseed rape etc.{Professional {farm management}has been employed to achieve very high levels of producti- vity through greater mechanisation, the careful application of more effective chemicals, and better use of staff and land resource planning. Employment is 10% of what it was five years ago with 2 skilled workers for 2,000 acres, and 2 Game Keepers maintaining a shoot which produces 7,000+ pheasants annually for sale in a London store, adding to farm income.
